sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Sky Harbour Group Announces an Expansion to its Future New York Stewart International Airport Hangar Campus
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corporation is expanding its development site at New York Stewart International Airport (SWF) from 16 to 26 acres, increasing rentable hangar space by approximately 150,000 square feet. This expansion is expected to boost revenues, offer development cost advantages through a more efficient layout, and enhance operating margins across several New York and Connecticut locations. The SWF campus aims to provide premium home-basing for business aircraft, creating local jobs and economic benefits for the Hudson Valley region.

feed.title: Sky Harbour Issues Shares to Enhance Liquidity
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group is actively working to improve its liquidity and fund operations in the private aviation infrastructure sector. This involves issuing a non-convertible promissory note worth $15 million and 50,000 shares of its Class A common stock. Despite these strategic growth initiatives, TipRanks’ AI Analyst indicates a "Neutral" outlook for SKYH due to financial challenges like high leverage and negative profitability.

feed.title: Sky Harbour issues shares to enhance liquidity
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corporation (SKYH) announced an offering of up to $50 million of its Class A common stock to enhance liquidity. The shares will be sold through an "at the market" offering program where funds will be used for general corporate purposes. This strategic move aims to bolster the company's financial flexibility.

feed.title: Sky Harbour Announces Two New Hangar Campus Developments at Dallas Love Field (DAL) and Dallas Executive Airport (RBD) and Financing Updates
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corporation announced new hangar campus developments at Dallas Love Field (DAL) and Dallas Executive Airport (RBD), expanding its network to 23 airports nationwide. The company also detailed financing updates, including a $15 million corporate loan from Yorkville Advisors Global, LP and a $9.5 million commercial term loan for its manufacturing subsidiary, Stratus Building Systems, Inc. These developments aim to create jobs and provide state-of-the-art facilities for corporate and private business aircraft in the Dallas market.

feed.title: Sky Harbour Announces Two New Hangar Campus Developments at Dallas Love Field (DAL) and Dallas Executive Airport (RBD) and Financing Updates
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corporation announced the Dallas City Council has authorized ground lease agreements for new HBO campuses at Dallas Love Field (DAL) and Dallas Executive Airport (RBD), expanding its network to 23 airports nationwide. These developments aim to create jobs and economic benefits for Dallas by providing state-of-the-art hangars and services for business aircraft. Additionally, Sky Harbour provided updates on its capital formation, including a new $15 million corporate loan and a $9.5 million term loan for its manufacturing subsidiary, Stratus Building Systems.

feed.title: New York's Sky Harbour To Develop New Hangar Campuses at Love Field, Dallas Executive Airport, and FW Meacham
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group (NYSE: SKYH) has secured approvals to develop eight new home base operator hangars across Dallas Love Field, Dallas Executive Airport, and Fort Worth Meacham International Airport. These new campuses will cater to corporate and private business aircraft in the DFW region, providing state-of-the-art hangars, office suites, and dedicated line-service. This expansion marks Sky Harbour's third set of HBO campuses in Texas, increasing its nationwide network to 23 locations.

feed.title: Sky Harbour Announces New Dallas-Fort Worth, Texas (FTW) Hangar Campus Development
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corporation announced the development of a new Home Base Operator (HBO) campus at Fort Worth Meacham International Airport (FTW), authorized by the City of Fort Worth. This marks Sky Harbour's third campus in Texas and 21st nationwide, offering state-of-the-art hangars and services for business aircraft. The project is expected to create local jobs and economic benefits for Fort Worth.

feed.title: Sky Harbour Announces New Dallas-Fort Worth, Texas (FTW) Hangar Campus Development
authors: Sky Harbour Group Corporation via Business Wire
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corporation announced the development of a new Home Base Operator (HBO) campus at Fort Worth Meacham International Airport (FTW), authorized by the City of Fort Worth. This facility will be Sky Harbour's third HBO campus in Texas and 21st nationwide, offering state-of-the-art hangars, office and lounge suites, and dedicated line services for corporate and private business aircraft. The project is expected to create jobs and generate significant economic benefits for Fort Worth.

feed.title: Sky Harbour Group Corp. Hits New 52-Week Low at $8.22
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corp., a microcap realty firm, recently hit a new 52-week low of $8.22, marking a 16.5% decline over the past year. The company operates at a loss with an undefined P/E ratio, no dividend yield, and a negative return on equity of -11.80%. This downturn highlights the company's challenges in the competitive realty industry.

feed.title: [Form 4] Sky Harbour Group Corp Insider Trading Activity
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corp (SKYH) reported an insider equity transaction where its Chief Financial Officer acquired 4,500 Class A common shares at $8.34 each on November 24, 2025. This transaction increased the officer's beneficial ownership to 521,518 Class A shares, encompassing common stock, restricted stock units, and non-qualified stock options. The filing details the RSU vesting schedule and stock option exercisable dates.

feed.title: Lake Street Remains a Buy on Sky Harbour Group (SKYH)
feed.summary: Lake Street analyst Ryan Meyers has reiterated a Buy rating on Sky Harbour Group (SKYH) with a $14 price target. This follows a similar Buy rating from Noble Financial, despite a Hold rating from TR | OpenAI – 4o. Sky Harbour Group recently reported a quarterly revenue of $7.3 million and a GAAP net loss of $1.88 million for the quarter ending September 30.

feed.title: Sky Harbour to Report Its Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results and Host Webcast Investor Call on November 12th, 2025
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corporation announced it will release its Third Quarter 2025 financial results and file its quarterly report on Form 10-Q after market close on November 12th, 2025. The company will also host an investor webcast on the same day at 5:00 pm ET to review financial results and provide a business update, followed by a Q&A session. The webcast and conference call details are provided for public access.

feed.title: Sky Harbour Group Corp. Hits New 52-Week Low at $8.88
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corp., a microcap realty firm, recently hit a new 52-week low of USD 8.88 on November 17, 2025. This downturn reflects a 1-year performance decline of 9.76% and comes amidst challenges including a negative return on equity and a high debt-to-equity ratio, contrasting with the S&P 500's gain. The company, with a market capitalization of USD 766 million, is not currently generating profits and faces a competitive industry landscape.

feed.title: Sky Harbour Group Corporation (SKYH) Reports Q3 Loss, Misses Revenue Estimates
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corporation (SKYH) reported a third-quarter loss of $0.09 per share, missing the Zacks Consensus Estimate of a $0.05 loss per share. The company posted revenues of $5.99 million for the quarter, falling short of the consensus estimate of $7 million. This represents a significant year-over-year revenue increase of 46.8%.

feed.title: Sky Harbour Group Reports Revenue Growth Amid Losses
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corporation (SKYH) announced its Q3 earnings, revealing a significant increase in total revenue to $7.3 million, up from $4.1 million year-over-year, driven by rental and fuel revenue. Despite this growth, the company reported an operating loss of $7.7 million due to increased expenses. However, an unrealized gain on warrants contributed to a net income of $577,000 for the nine months ended September 30, 2025, a substantial improvement from a $37.7 million loss in the prior year.

feed.title: Sky Harbour to build private aircraft facility at Long Beach Airport
feed.summary: Sky Harbour, a New York-based aviation company, is set to establish a private aircraft facility at Long Beach Airport. The company plans to introduce its "home base" concept for private aircraft owners in Southern California, involving the construction of hangar space to accommodate business aircraft.

feed.title: Sky Harbour Announces New Long Beach, California (LGB) Hangar Campus Development
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corporation announced the execution of a ground lease agreement with the City of Long Beach, California, for the development of a new Home Base Operator (HBO) campus at Long Beach Airport (LGB). This 19th location for Sky Harbour will serve the Long Beach, Orange County, and Greater Los Angeles regions, offering state-of-the-art hangars and dedicated line services for business aircraft. The two-phase development is expected to generate significant economic benefits and create hundreds of local jobs in Southern California.

feed.title: Boston Omaha Corp sells Sky Harbour Group shares worth $453,445
feed.summary: Boston Omaha Corp sold 40,346 shares of Sky Harbour Group Corp (NYSE: SKYH) Class A common stock for approximately $453,445 between April 15 and April 17, 2025. Despite the sale, Boston Omaha Corp maintains a significant stake in Sky Harbour through direct and subsidiary holdings. Sky Harbour Group Corp reported significant revenue growth for Q4 2024, doubling year-over-year, and continues strategic expansions while maintaining strong liquidity.

feed.title: Sky Harbour Group uplists to the NYSE
feed.summary: Aviation infrastructure developer Sky Harbour Group has successfully uplisted from the NYSE American to the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE), with trading under "SKYH" and "SKYH WS" commencing January 27, 2025. The company also completed the second closing of its equity raise, generating approximately $37.6 million, bringing the total to $75.2 million, to fund development at new airport campuses. Sky Harbour anticipates securing seven new ground leases by the end of 2024, expanding its portfolio to 23 airports.

feed.title: Sky Harbour Group Corporation Class A (SKYH) reports earnings
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corporation Class A (SKYH) reported its earnings for the year, detailing a significant increase in revenue to $14.8 million but also an expanded net loss of $53.7 million, largely due to an unrealized loss on warrants. The company's expansion strategy focuses on growing its hangar campus network, funded by recent private placements, while acknowledging risks related to construction costs and interest rates. As of December 31, 2024, the company held $127.2 million in liquidity and reported remediation of past material weaknesses in internal controls.

feed.title: Sky Harbour Group Corporation to Present at the LD Micro Main Event XIX - MarketScreener
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corporation (NYSE: SKYH) announced it will present at the 19th annual LD Micro Main Event XIX on October 21, 2025, in San Diego, California. Andreas Frank, Assistant Treasurer, will deliver the presentation. The event, running from October 19th to 21st, will feature company presentations and investor meetings, providing a platform for Sky Harbour to engage with the small-cap investment community.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: Sky Harbour Q2 2025 revenue climbs, stock stable
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corp (SKYH) reported an 82% year-over-year increase in Q2 2025 revenue to $6.6 million, exceeding forecasts, with a stable stock performance marked by a modest 1.37% aftermarket rise. The company is actively expanding, opening new campuses in Phoenix, Dallas, and Denver, and projects significant revenue growth for the remainder of 2025, supported by a newly secured $200 million debt facility. Key successes include pre-leasing initiatives and strategic vertical integration in construction, alongside maintaining a strong focus on operational excellence and customer service in the business aviation market.

feed.title: Sky Harbour Announces New Portland (Oregon) Campus Development at Hillsboro Airport (HIO)
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corporation announced a new ground lease agreement with the Port of Portland for a Home Base hangar campus development at Hillsboro Airport (HIO). This two-phase development on approximately 13 acres is expected to create jobs and generate significant economic benefits for the Portland area. The campus will provide state-of-the-art hangars and dedicated line services for business aircraft.

feed.title: Sky Harbour Group (NYSE:SKYH) - Stock Analysis
feed.summary: This report provides a stock analysis for Sky Harbour Group (NYSE:SKYH), detailing its current market cap, share price, and analyst forecasts. It includes an overview of the company's valuation, future growth prospects, past performance, financial health, and dividend information, alongside recent news and competitor comparisons. The analysis highlights the company's strong potential in aviation infrastructure development, driven by private aviation demand and scalable vertical integration.

feed.title: Sky Harbour Announces Initial Closing of Equity Raise, Upsized by Additional Participation of Existing and New Long-Term Investors
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corporation announced the initial closing of an equity raise, issuing 3,955,790 PIPE shares for approximately $37.58 million at $9.50 per share, exceeding initial expectations due to additional investor participation. A second closing for up to an additional $37.58 million is scheduled for December 20, 2024, with the combined proceeds intended to fund phase 1 development at 6-7 new airport campuses and support construction through 2026. The company is also scheduled to present at the 2024 LD Micro Main Event XVII.

feed.title: Sky Harbour To Develop Campus At Trenton-Mercer Airport
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group Corporation has signed a lease agreement with Mercer County to develop a 10-acre campus at Trenton-Mercer Airport (TTN). This development aims to create hundreds of local jobs and boost the economy in Ewing Township by providing state-of-the-art hangars and services for business aviation. The new facility will offer a premier home base for corporate and privately-owned business jets in New Jersey, enhancing the airport's status as a key business aviation hub.

feed.title: Sky Harbour To Add Private Aircraft Hangars in California and New Jersey
feed.summary: Sky Harbour is expanding its private hangar network by adding new facilities near Los Angeles and New York City. The former CloudNine hangar complex at California's Camarillo Airport will be rebranded as a Sky Harbour location, and plans are underway for a new facility in New Jersey. This expansion marks their fifth and upcoming locations respectively, aiming to serve the private aircraft storage market on both U.S. coasts.

feed.title: Insider Purchase: Director at Sky Harbour Group (SKYH) Buys 52,632 Shares
feed.summary: Alexander Buffett Rozek, a director at Sky Harbour Group (SKYH), purchased 52,632 shares of the company on October 25, 2024, increasing his holdings by 27.0% to a total of 247,370 shares. Sky Harbour Group has seen a mix of insider buys and sells in the last six months, with institutional investors also showing significant activity in their holdings. The company specializes in developing and operating private aviation infrastructure and FBO facilities.

feed.title: Dulles gets more private jet hangars
feed.summary: Dulles International Airport, one of the busiest for private jet traffic, is expanding its facilities with new hangars. Sky Harbour Group Corporation is developing a "Home Base" campus on 18 acres, which will create hundreds of jobs and house top corporate and privately-owned business jets. The new development aims to meet the growing demand for private flight services, with top destinations including recreational spots like Miami and Aspen, and major business hubs.

feed.title: Why Business Aircraft Have a Homelessness Problem
feed.summary: The article discusses the growing problem of hangar shortages for business aircraft in the U.S., attributing it to an increase in the size and number of business jets, coupled with a decrease in public-use airports and stricter building codes for new hangars. This scarcity has led to long waiting lists and higher prices for hangar space, creating significant inconvenience and additional expense for aircraft owners. Solutions, such as companies developing new hangar facilities, are emerging but the problem remains acute.

feed.title: Westchester-Based Aviation Hangar Company Sky Harbour Goes Public
feed.summary: Sky Harbour Group, a Westchester-based aviation hangar company, went public on January 26, 2022, trading on the NYSE American under the symbol SKYH, following a business combination with Yellowstone Acquisition Company. The company, which designs, develops, leases, and manages business aviation hangar campuses across the U.S., plans significant expansion to over 50 airports and an increased brand presence. Despite its nationwide growth, Sky Harbour intends to maintain its headquarters in Westchester, reporting an estimated post-transaction equity market value of $600 million.

feed.title: MoFo Advises Sky Harbour LLC in Business Combination with Yellowstone Acquisition Company
feed.summary: Morrison & Foerster advised Sky Harbour LLC in its business combination with Yellowstone Acquisition Company, a SPAC. The deal, completed on January 25, 2022, resulted in the combined company being named Sky Harbour Group Corporation. Sky Harbour aims to address the private aviation hangar shortage by establishing a network of upscale business aviation hangar complexes.
